oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cedarcrest Jamboree - 1952-11-01 - WSM - part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two excerpts of Cedarcrest shoes sponsored Cedarcrest Jamboree, originally broadcast November 1 and 8, 1952, as stated on cue sheet and label, part 1 of each segment. Featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Carl Smith (host ,announcer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Ernest Tubb (performer), Grady Martin (performer), Bobby Forrester (performer), Moon Mullican (performer), Sammy Pruett (performer), and Hal Smith (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Carl Smith; Little Jimmy Dickens; Ernest Tubb; Grady Martin; Bobby Forrester; Moon Mullican; Sammy Pruett; Hal Smith
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Louis Buck announces line-up -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Louis Buck introduces Carl Smith -- I Betcha My Heart I Love You (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith talks about the performers and introduces Grady Martin -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Grady Martin fiddle) -- Carl Smith introduces Ernest Tubb -- Ernest Tubb thanks Smith and talks about his Cedarcrest work shoes -- Somebody's Stolen My Honey (Ernest Tubb) -- Panhandle Rag (Bobby Forrester steel guitar) -- Carl Smith introduces the next song -- Let's Live A Little Before We Say Goodbye (Carl Smith) -- Louis Buck announces line-up -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Louis Buck introduces Carl Smith -- Our Honeymoon (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith welcomes the audience and introduces Sammy Pruett -- Maggie Blue (Sammy Pruett guitar) -- Carl Smith introduces Moon Mullican -- I Was Sorta Wonderin' (Moon Mullican) -- Carl Smith introduces Hal Smith -- Sally Goodin (Hal Smith fiddle) -- Carl Smith introduces the next song -- Yesterday's Winner Is A Loser Today (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Moon Mullican's next song -- Pipeliners Blues (Moon Mullican)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Cedarcrest jamboree (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Forrester, Bobby; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Pruett, Sammy; Smith, Hal, 1923-2008;
